title: Louisiana Public Health Institute Enhances Research Develop
text:
SANTA CLARA, Calif. , Sept. 3, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- The Louisiana Clinical Data Research Network (LaCDRN), a program within the Louisiana Public Health Institute (LPHI) , has deployed Radia Mobility Management , an Accelerite product to better manage, protect, and secure the computing devices it uses to collect patient information in an increasingly mobility-driven environment. LPHI, a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, manages a variety of community health programs across the state to improve the health and quality of life of all Louisianans where they live, work, learn and play. LPHI also provides an array of services to local and national partner organizations that enables them to focus on improving patient health outcomes—regardless of demographic, income, and geography. 
LaCDRN deployed Accelerite's Radia Mobility Management solution through the cloud to secure and manage tablet computers used by researchers collecting patient outcomes in participating health systems. The extensible unified endpoint management (UEM) platform of Radia enables LPHI to securely manage an increasing number of tablets and other devices, regardless of platform, as LPHI expands its research trials.
Supporting Quotes 
"Deploying Radia Mobility Management has helped us increase our research agility and effectiveness by boosting the speed and access for our tablets in the field without having to make any compromises in data security and compliance. Using Radia, we've been able to improve our data collection and collaboration system-wide, all within our budget. Accelerite offers ease-of-use, cost-effectiveness, and scalability giving both our IT teams and field researchers an added layer of flexibility that's expanding our capabilities and helping us to better advance our mission."
– Eliel Oliveira , Associate Director, Louisiana Public Health Institute-LACDRN 
"From enterprises to SMBs, organizations such as LPHI are increasingly in search of secure, reliable, and scalable endpoint management solutions that can be tailored to their unique industry and deployment needs. Radia delivers with its high-levels of automation and unrivalled scalability enabled LPHI to simplify IT administration and create seamless and secure data collection in clinics in multiple states. Accelerite is committed to supporting LPHI's efforts towards better health for all. We will continue to deploy Radia's unique unified management solution as LPHI extends its data gathering to additional types of endpoint devices."
– Harshal Shah , Senior Director, Healthcare, Accelerite

About Radia / Radia Mobility Management
Radia Mobility Management offers fully integrated mobile device, application, and content security management (MDM, MAM, MCM), and more to enable. You can deploy Radia Mobility Management either as a separate tool to manage only your mobile devices, or leverage the full capabilities of the Radia Endpoint Manager extensible console to manage all of your enterprise endpoints, including smartphones, tablets, laptops, PCs, servers, virtual environments, industry-specific devices such as ATMs, POS systems, and more. Radia is offered in on-premise, cloud, and hybrid deployment modules.
About the Louisiana Public Health Institute (LPHI) 
Founded in 1997, The Louisiana Public Health Institute's mission is to promote and improve the health and quality of life in Louisiana through public-private partnering at the community, parish and state levels. By fostering collaborative endeavors in the areas of health information, public policy, applied research, and community capacity enhancement, LPHI works to develop community-oriented solutions that improve the health of the Louisiana population. For more information, visit www.lphi.org .
About LaCDRN
Launched in March 2014 and awarded an initial $6.9 M by the Patient Centered Outcomes Research Institution (PCORI), the Louisiana Clinical Data Research Network (LaCDRN) is a partnership between the Louisiana Public Health Institute, Ochsner Health System, Partnership for Achieving Total Health (PATH), Louisiana State University , Pennington Biomedical Research Center, Tulane University and Baylor Scott & White Health. The second phase of this initiative will begin in September 2015 with an additional $6.9 M by PCORI for the next three years, this collaborative partnership will continue to increase the capacity to conduct robust comparative effectiveness research by building a health information technology infrastructure that provides access to comprehensive clinical data for more than one million patients in Louisiana .
